source.d5778495:
import janestreet
env = janestreet.make_env() # initialize the environment
iter_test = env.iter_test() # an iterator which loops over the test set

for (test_df, sample_prediction_df) in iter_test:
    sample_prediction_df.action = 0 #make your 0/1 prediction here
    env.predict(sample_prediction_df)
source.ac3bd956: For exploration purposes we limit the number of rows to 500k (2.3M rows total). This can be changed through the "nrows" argument.
source.b64e4206: So in this notebook, we'll load the data, remove columns for training, separate into a train + test set, and run some (very) preliminary analyses. If this helped you hit the ground running, feel free to fork and upvote!
